steward.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
steward.translation[0].definitions[1].de: someone who is in charge of a horse race, meeting, or other public event
steward.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone who protects something or is responsible for it, especially something such as nature, public property, or money
steward.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Kissinger was now chief steward of US foreign policy.
steward.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a man whose job is to manage a large property, such as a farm
steward.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a man who serves food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
steward.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a worker who is elected by members of a TRADE UNION in a factory or other business to represent them when dealing with managers
steward.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: A meeting of shop stewards approved the strike action.
